list.name: Changes
list.comment:
Update Game Controller to ignore inputs while solving
The Game Controller now ignores any mouse clicks if the game is in 'solving' state. This prevents unexpected behavior during automatic solving process. Also, excessive whitespaces were removed and comments have been added for better readability and understanding of the code. SDL2_image package was removed from CMakeLists as it was not in use.

task.summary: Default task
Start of project.

Base of the project
Added the project architecture, added libs for GUI SDL2

Implement GameController and enhance game logic
Added full implementation to GameController, implementing SDL event handling and game control logistics. Additional methods have also been introduced to Game, GameController and Tower classes for handling user input, game and view updates, disk movement, and game resolution. The GameView rendering logic has been improved and some protections against possible divisions by zero have been added.

Refactor GameController to handle mouse events
Rewrote the handleUserInput() function in GameController to handle mouse events, alongside the existing keyboard handling. The update allows the game to accept user inputs for disk selection and moving, enhancing the game logic and interaction. Also introduced GameControllerState to manage the current game state.

Implement user interaction features in GameView
Added new functions in GameView for handling user interactions within the game. This includes processing mouse clicks for tower and disk selection, and creating interactive on-screen buttons for game functions like restart and solve. This enhancement provides a more interactive and user-friendly gaming experience. Fixed disk width calculation in calculateDiskRect function. Modified moveDisk method in GameController to return a bool.

Enhance user interaction and fix game play issues
Added functionality in 'Tower' to handle exceptions when invalid disk selection occurs. Moved libraries inclusion from main to disk for smooth interaction. Optimized disk movement by modifying input and validation mechanisms in 'Game'. Improved logging and game initiation in 'main'.

Added SDL2_ttf support and improved button rendering
Included SDL2 and SDL2_ttf libraries in CMakeLists as well as in the GameView source code, enabling font rendering capabilities. The GameView's button rendering and click detection methods have been revised for better visual appeal with text labels. Additionally, redirected stderr to logfile in the main source.

Update graphics rendering and game UI functionality
Enhanced the graphics of the game, using SDL2 and SDL2_ttf libraries to improve rendering capabilities. Redesigned the game buttons for improved usability and added features for re-sizing and color gradients. The commit includes error logging facilitation that redirects the stderr to a log file.

Refactor game control and enhance game solving strategy
The game control flow was adjusted to make the interaction more intuitive, including the simplification of game start and restart processes. The automatic game solve feature was improved to be more efficient, incorporating a recursive solve approach for moving disks between towers in the Tower of Hanoi game. The changes improve the overall user experience during gameplay.

Refactor game initialization and add disk functions
The game's initialization was rewritten to make use of the new setNumberOfDisks function, which also handles tower setup and color configuration for each disk. Other functions were added to provide further control over the game such as getNumberOfMoves, getLargestDiskSize, isGameStarted, getNumberOfDisks. Game control flow was simplified and improved, providing a better gaming experience.

Add SDL2_image library and minor refactoring of main.cpp
The SDL2_image library was added to the project in the CMakeLists.txt file, allowing future image handling in the game. In a separate, minor change, the "render game" comment in main.cpp was moved to a more appropriate location immediately above the view.render() function.

Refactor Tower class and enhance functionality in Game class
Adjusted the `getTop` method in the `Tower` class to be constant. Modified the `getLargestDiskSize` method in the `Game` class to now set `largestDiskSize` before returning. Introduced additional methods, `removeDisk` and `returnDisk`, to the `Game` class for improved game operations.

Refactor GameController to improve disk handling
Removed GameControllerState enum, replacing it with an isDiskGrabbed flag in GameView. This simplifies the handling of user input, reducing nesting and making the logic easier to follow. Additionally, added methods to remove and return disks to the GameController, increasing modularity and allowing for more flexible game operations.

Improve drag-and-drop functionality in GameView
Enhanced game's drag-and-drop mechanism by introducing 'isDiskGrabbed' flag which simplifies the tracking process. Included the addition of a new 'renderDiskWhenGrabbed' method for rendering the grabbed disk at the current mouse position. This upgrade in code design enhances the game's user interactivity while maintaining simplicity and readability.

Restart game before solving in GameController
Added a call to restart the game in GameController before solving it to ensure a clean start. Also adjusted the predefined colors array in the Game class for better color representation. These changes improve the solvability of the game and the overall visual experience for the user.

Simplify GameController and add exit logic
Eliminated unnecessary attributes and logic from GameController, including isRunning, selectedDisk, and selectedTower. Integrated exit flow logic in GameController. This refactor simplifies the GameController class and its workflow, further enhancing the user's ability to exit the game when needed.

Implement game state checking and animation in game logic
Updated game logic to include checks for game state before allowing certain actions, such as mouse events. An animation function has also been added to visually represent disk movement. The updates improve the game's user experience by preventing incorrect actions from being performed and enhancing visual feedback during gameplay.

Refactor README.md and update game features
The README.md file has been refactored and the game features in it have been updated. The new features include the ability to change the number of disks and the addition of a game solver. The refactor is aimed at improving readability and providing users with information about the latest game features and gameplay.

Update README.md with library details and game instructions
Expanded the Libraries section in README.md and added detailed gaming instructions with respective images. This change clarifies library usage and provides clear, illustrated steps on how to play the game, which will enhance user experience and game understanding.

Added detailed comments to Ninja log and build.ninja for increased clarity. Adjusted configuration variables for custom commands, object build statements and link build statements to improve system performance. These changes will aid developers in understanding the project's configuration and build system.

Update Game Controller to ignore inputs while solving
The Game Controller now ignores any mouse clicks if the game is in 'solving' state. This prevents unexpected behavior during automatic solving process. Also, excessive whitespaces were removed and comments have been added for better readability and understanding of the code. SDL2_image package was removed from CMakeLists as it was not in use.
